vulnerabilities.name: SQL Injection
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack technique that exploits inadequate validation of user input in SQL queries, allowing attackers to manipulate a database.

vulnerabilities.name: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
vulnerabilities.clue: A vulnerability that allows attackers to inject malicious scripts into web pages viewed by other users.

vulnerabilities.name: Buffer Overflow
vulnerabilities.clue: In this attack the attacker alters the application’s execution path and overwrites elements of its memory, which amends the program’s execution path to damage existing files or expose data.

vulnerabilities.name: Remote Code Execution
vulnerabilities.clue: An vulnerability in which an attacker is able to run any commands or code of the their choice on a target machine or in a target process.

vulnerabilities.name: Denial of Service
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack that aims to overwhelm a system, network, or service to render it unavailable to users.

vulnerabilities.name: Man in the Middle Attack
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack where an attacker intercepts communication between two parties without their knowledge, potentially eavesdropping or altering data.

vulnerabilities.name: Arbitrary code execution
vulnerabilities.clue: This is an attacker's ability to run any commands or code of the attacker's choice on a target machine or in a target process

vulnerabilities.name: XXE Injection
vulnerabilities.clue: A vulnerability that allows an attacker to exploit insecure XML parsers to disclose internal files, execute remote requests, or launch a DoS attack.

vulnerabilities.name: Server Side Request Forgery
vulnerabilities.clue: A vulnerability that enables attackers to make unauthorized requests from a vulnerable server, potentially accessing internal resources or services.

vulnerabilities.name: Path Traversal
vulnerabilities.clue: A vulnerability that allows attackers to access files and directories outside the intended directory, potentially disclosing sensitive information.

vulnerabilities.name: Clickjacking
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack where a malicious website or element is positioned over a legitimate site to trick users into clicking on something different from what they see.

vulnerabilities.name: Session Fixation
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack where an attacker sets a user's session identifier to a known value, potentially allowing unauthorized access to the user's account.

vulnerabilities.name: Cryptographic Side Channel Attacks
vulnerabilities.clue: A class of vulnerabilities where attackers exploit information leaked by cryptographic implementations, such as timing or power consumption.

vulnerabilities.name: Race Conditions
vulnerabilities.clue: A class of vulnerabilities that occur when multiple processes access shared data simultaneously, leading to unintended consequences.

vulnerabilities.name: Zero Day Vulnerability
vulnerabilities.clue: A previously unknown security flaw in software or hardware that is exploited by attackers before the vendor has a chance to develop and release a patch.

vulnerabilities.name: Brute Force Attack
vulnerabilities.clue: An attack where an attacker systematically tries all possible combinations to guess a user's password or encryption key.

vulnerabilities.name: Data Breach
vulnerabilities.clue: An incident where sensitive or confidential data is exposed to unauthorized users, often resulting in harm to individuals or organizations.

vulnerabilities.name: Biometric Vulnerabilities
vulnerabilities.clue: Vulnerabilities related to the use of biometric authentication methods, including fingerprint and facial recognition, that can be exploited by attackers.

vulnerabilities.name: Supply Chain Attacks
vulnerabilities.clue: Attacks that target the software supply chain, compromising the integrity of software or hardware components before they reach the end user.

vulnerabilities.name: Software Composition
vulnerabilities.clue: Vulnerabilities stemming from insecure third-party software components used in an application, which can introduce security flaws.
